intro: Wikstroemia longifolia var. langbiangensis, commonly known as the Langbiang wikstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the Langbiang Plateau in Vietnam. It belongs to the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in montane forests. This variety is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological and floral traits.
